channel.title: ScanX – Orders & Deals

item.title: A-1 Limited Signs Supply Deal for Nitric Acid
item.description: Top News A-1 Limited Signs Supply Deal for Nitric Acid 14 minutes ago A-1 Limited has entered into a strategic tri-partite supply arrangement for Concentrated Nitric Acid involving GNFC as manufacturer and Solar Industries as end user. The deal covers 10,000 metric tonnes from November 2025 to March 2026, enhancing the company's position in specialty chemicals distribution and providing volume visibility through partnerships with nationally reputed corporates.

item.title: VST Tillers Tractors Showcases Advanced Engineering Solutions at EXCON
item.description: VST Tillers Tractors Showcases Advanced Engineering Solutions at EXCON 14 minutes ago VST Tillers Tractors participated in EXCON in Bengaluru, showcasing its evolution from a farm equipment manufacturer to a diversified engineering company. The company displayed advanced compact engines (3 and 4-cylinder, 17HP to 30HP) and precision components for various industries. A key highlight was the 13HP horizontal engine, supporting both agriculture and construction. VST's engines are contributing to India's infrastructure development. CEO Antony Cherukara emphasized the company's focus on innovation, precision engineering, and global market expansion. VST's quality has been recognized through multiple awards, reinforcing its commitment to excellence.

item.title: Tata Power Issues ₹2,000 Crore Non-Convertible Debentures on Private Placement Basis
item.description: Tata Power Issues ₹2,000 Crore Non-Convertible Debentures on Private Placement Basis 1 minute ago Tata Power announces ₹2,000.00 crore NCD issuance through private placement, comprising 2,00,000 debentures with ₹1,00,000.00 face value each. The unsecured NCDs feature two series with 3-year and 5-year maturity options, bullet repayment structure, and AA/Stable credit ratings. The debentures will be listed on BSE debt segment with deemed allotment date of December 19, 2025.

item.title: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years
item.description: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years 9 hours ago Reliance Retail, India's largest retail chain and a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, has announced plans to potentially launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) within the next three years. This move could provide investors an opportunity to participate in India's retail sector growth, enhance the company's access to capital, and increase operational transparency. As India's largest retail chain, Reliance Retail's potential IPO could be a significant event in the Indian market.
